title: Who was the first viceroy of India under British rule? - Quora

response.answer_text: Lord Canning. The position of the Viceroy was established in the Queen’s Proclamation, 1858. According to that act, the Governor General of India will get an additional title of Viceroy, who will be directly appointed by the crown. This is because, immediately after 1857, the control of India was passed from the East India Company to the British Crown. Lord Canning was the Governor General of India before 1857 and he continued as the Viceroy of India after 1857.

The first viceroy of India under British rule was Lord caning. He was the last governor general of India too under company rule. The company rule of India was abolished by Government of India act 1858. India was placed directly under the crown of England and on behalf of British parliament one minister from British cabinet was appointed as secretary of state to look after the affairs of India and he was answerable to British parliament.
